programme.title: Klārksona ferma 2
programme.desc: Lielbritānijas slavenākā un vienlaikus visneprasmīgākā lauksaimnieka Džeremija Klārksona fermā sācies vēl viens trakulīgs gads. Cirpt aitas, vākt svaigi dētas vistu olas, audzēt labību – plāns ir ambiciozs un, kā jau mēdz gadīties, ne līdz galam pārdomāts. Lai palielinātu pērnā gada niecīgo peļņu, kas bija tikai 144 mārciņas, Džeremijs šosezon nolemj paplašināt darbību. Saimniecības kuplajai lopu saimei pievienojas liellopi un vēl vairāk vistu, bet ar to viss nebeidzas. Klārksons ver vaļā arī savu restorānu!

programme.title: Ips Mans 2
programme.desc: Cīņas meistars Ips Mans pārceļas uz Honkongu, kur atver austrumu cīņu skolu. Tomēr drīz uzrodas konkurents, kurš glabā tumšu noslēpumu. Viņa vadītā korumpētu cīņas mākslas meistaru banda atsakās ļaut Ipam mācīt citus, kamēr viņš nepierādīs sevi kā izcilu kung fu meistaru.

programme.title: Sliktie puiši uz mūžu
programme.desc: Sliktie puiši ir atpakaļ! Tiesa gan, viņi dzīvo katrs savu dzīvi. Maikam ir pusmūža krīze, viņš braukā ar sporta automobiļiem un regulāri iekuļas nepatikšanās. Markuss ir nodibinājis ģimeni, kļuvis par policijas inspektoru un arvien biežāk domā par pensionēšanos. Taču, kad pēc Maika dzīvības sāk tīkot noslēpumaini noziedznieki, leģendārais duets atkal apvienojas, lai paveiktu vēl vienu bīstamu misiju.

programme.title: Antikvariāts uz riteņiem
programme.desc: Antīko lietu pārzinātāja Kristīna Trevainjona un amatnieks Vils Kērks apceļo Lielbritānijas mājsaimniecības, noslauka putekļus no tur atrastām, nenovērtētām pērlēm un atklāj to stāstus. Daudz nevilcinoties, šie dārgumu mednieki ķeras pie relikviju rūpīgas atjaunošanas un, kad lietas atguvušas agrāko spozmi, ļauj tām nonākt pareizajās rokās, dodot jaunu dzīvi.

programme.title: Antikvariāts uz riteņiem
programme.desc: Antīko lietu pārzinātāja Kristīna Trevainjona un amatnieks Vils Kērks apceļo Lielbritānijas mājsaimniecības, noslauka putekļus no tur atrastām, nenovērtētām pērlēm un atklāj to stāstus. Daudz nevilcinoties, šie dārgumu mednieki ķeras pie relikviju rūpīgas atjaunošanas un, kad lietas atguvušas agrāko spozmi, ļauj tām nonākt pareizajās rokās, dodot jaunu dzīvi.

programme.title: Mana trakā ģimene 19
programme.desc: Pavisam “parasto” Grifinu ģimeni no izdomātās Rodailendas pilsētiņas droši var raksturot kā neaudzinātu, izlutinātu un absolūti nekorektu. Pītera un Luisas Grifinu jaunākais bērns ir inteliģents, sadistisks mazulis, kurš pastāvīgi meklē savu māti un kaļ plānus par pasaules pārņemšanu. Dēlam Krisam ir tikpat zems intelekta līmenis kā viņa tēvam, meita Mega veltīgi cenšas sadraudzēties ar “foršajiem cilvēkiem”, taču vienmēr tiek atstumta. Tikmēr runājošais un martīni malkojošais ģimenes suns Braiens ir vienīgais, kam ir kaut kripatiņa saprāta.

programme.title: Tāskmāsters 8
programme.desc: Joku šovs, kurā slaveni britu komiķi veic ārkārtīgi dīvainus uzdevumus un tāskmāsters Gregs Deiviss tos pienācīgi novērtē. Sagadījies tā, ka Grega palīgs Alekss Horns ir apveltīts ne tikai ar bezgalīgu uzticību, bet arī dīvainībām pilnu prātu. Astotajā sezonā Alekss tāskmāstera uzdevumā izaicinās komiķus gan nomizot banānu ar savām pēdām, to nesabojājot, gan izveidot ticamu ievainojamu, izmantojot pārtikas produktus, gan trāpīt bumbu vārtos no iespējami tālākas distances ar vienu piegājienu.

programme.title: Klārksona ferma 2
programme.desc: Lielbritānijas slavenākā un vienlaikus visneprasmīgākā lauksaimnieka Džeremija Klārksona fermā sācies vēl viens trakulīgs gads. Cirpt aitas, vākt svaigi dētas vistu olas, audzēt labību – plāns ir ambiciozs un, kā jau mēdz gadīties, ne līdz galam pārdomāts. Lai palielinātu pērnā gada niecīgo peļņu, kas bija tikai 144 mārciņas, Džeremijs šosezon nolemj paplašināt darbību. Saimniecības kuplajai lopu saimei pievienojas liellopi un vēl vairāk vistu, bet ar to viss nebeidzas. Klārksons ver vaļā arī savu restorānu!

programme.title: Kobra 20
programme.desc: Klāt divdesmitā sezona slavenākajam Vācijas spriedzes seriālam „Kobra”! Kā jau jubilejas sezonai pieklājas, gaidāmi elpu aizraujoši notikumi un dramatiski pavērsieni. Glābjot citam cita dzīvības, būs brīži, kad uzvarēs pretinieks un tiks zaudēti visuzticamākie komandas biedri. Arī sēriju filmēšana saistīta ar vairākiem ievērības cienīgiem faktiem. No pilotsērijas uzņemšanas Albānijā līdz pamestam cietumam Berlīnē – „Kobras” komanda devusies ārpus filmēšanas paviljoniem, lai pārsteigtu skatītājus katrā sērijā. Turklāt šajā sezonā seriālā nofilmējušies ne vien labi pazīstami aktieri, bet arī autobraucējs Ralfs Šūmahers, divi vilki un viens vilku suns.

programme.title: Iesācēji 2
programme.desc: Policijas akadēmijas praktiskajā semestrī studenti turpina apgūt izmeklētāju aroda smalkumus. Piepalīdzot akadēmijas profesoriem, studenti šķetina asinsstindzinošus noziegumus, noslēpumus un upuru privātās dzīves mistērijas. Jauniņajiem gan bez kļūdām neiztikt – kā nekā tas viss viņiem vēl ir jauns un nezināms. Lai kļūtu par meistarīgiem detektīviem, topošie izmeklētāji salīdzinās teoriju ar reālo dzīvi, nereti izdarot secinājumus arī paši par sevi.

programme.title: Izgudrotāju pilsēta 3
programme.desc: Supervaronis, kurš staigā cauri sienām, otra saule, kas pēkšņi uzrodas blakus jau labi pazīstamajam debesu spīdeklim, nedzīvi priekšmeti, kuri dodas, kurp paši vēlas... Zinātnieki, kas visu laiku kaut ko izgudro. Izgudrojumi, kuros kaut kas noiet greizi. Un visam pa vidu šerifs Kārterers, kurš cenšas saglabāt kaut mazliet kārtības šajā haosā. Tas viss var notikt tikai vienā vietā uz zemes – Izgudrotāju pilsētā!

programme.title: Mana trakā ģimene 19
programme.desc: Pavisam “parasto” Grifinu ģimeni no izdomātās Rodailendas pilsētiņas droši var raksturot kā neaudzinātu, izlutinātu un absolūti nekorektu. Pītera un Luisas Grifinu jaunākais bērns ir inteliģents, sadistisks mazulis, kurš pastāvīgi meklē savu māti un kaļ plānus par pasaules pārņemšanu. Dēlam Krisam ir tikpat zems intelekta līmenis kā viņa tēvam, meita Mega veltīgi cenšas sadraudzēties ar “foršajiem cilvēkiem”, taču vienmēr tiek atstumta. Tikmēr runājošais un martīni malkojošais ģimenes suns Braiens ir vienīgais, kam ir kaut kripatiņa saprāta.

programme.title: Urbānās mistērijas
programme.desc: Pasaules megapilsētu rosīgās ielas glabā ne tikai brīnumainus kultūras dārgumus, bet arī rūpīgi slēptus noslēpumus. No baismīgajām Parīzes katakombām līdz dzīvīgajam Londonas kultūras epicentram Vestendā, no Ņujorkas vēsturiski nozīmīgās Brīvības statujas līdz Berlīnes mūra drupām, kas klātas ar grafiti, – vietējie gidi, blogeri un vēsturnieki atklās pilsētu apslēptos dārgakmeņus, kuru nozīme neuzmanīgam vērotājam var palikt nepamanīta.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: The Nazis did all they could behind enemy lines to keep the Luftwaffe in the air and set up shop in Kamienna Gora; do the abandoned plants and tunnels here hide Hitlers ultimate revenge weapon?
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: Rise and Fall: The Turning Points of World War II
programme.sub-title: We witness the final moments and aftermath of World War II with the establishment of war crime trials - such as the ones in Nuremberg - and move towards peace with the creation of the United Nations.
programme.desc: Through military campaigns, great battles, retreats, defeats and victories, we examine what decided the affair on and above the battlefields of Europe, Asia and North Africa and in the worlds oceans.

programme.title: World War II - Battles for Europe
programme.sub-title: July 1944: American forces plan a major offensive named Operation Cobra. They would attack near St Lo, achieve a breakthrough, then unleash General Patton and the US Third Army to exploit the opening.
programme.desc: From the beaches of Normandy to the heartland of the Third Reich, this programme delivers compelling and definitive stories of the battles fought to liberate Western Europe from the Nazis.

programme.title: The Giza Pyramid: Reaching For The Stars
programme.desc: The world is fascinated by the Pyramids of Giza; we explore theories and recent advances in archaeology, Egyptology and astrophysics to decipher the clues left behind by the ancient Egyptians.

programme.title: Eiffel: Towers War
programme.desc: The Eiffel Tower might never have seen the light of day; it owes its existence to the tenacity of visionary engineer Gustave Eiffel prevailing over his main rival architect Jules Bourdais.

programme.title: Roman Megastructures
programme.sub-title: During the Gallic Wars, Arles in the south of France fared really well. The most beautiful Roman monuments were built there, hence Arles was nicknamed the little Rome of Ancient Gaul.
programme.desc: We explore three cities that were once part of Julius Caesars quest to grow the Roman Empire; through the use of CGI and expert testimony, we unveil the secrets of these wonders of Roman engineering.

programme.title: Cursed Bloodlines
programme.sub-title: One of the richest men on Earth, Aristotle Onassis left a string of broken hearts in his wake, but no romance would catapult him into the limelight like his marriage to Jacqueline Kennedy.
programme.desc: From royal families spanning centuries to billionaire business tycoons and their clans, Cursed Bloodlines examines real-life historical instances of tragically ill-fated bloodlines.

programme.title: Mummies Unwrapped
programme.sub-title: The mangled mummy of Pharaoh Seqenenre Taa is a murder mystery that endures to this day; we discover the truth behind his brutal and humiliating death.
programme.desc: Come on a journey to some of the greatest mysteries of the ancient Egyptian world to discover the remarkable secrets behind unmarked sarcophagi, unusual burials, horribly disfigured mummies and more.

programme.title: From the Ashes of WWII
programme.sub-title: The scars of centuries of conflict are etched into Italys ancient landmarks; this episode explores how it rose from the devastating failure of fascism to the rebirth of its identity.
programme.desc: This is the story of how the cities that were attacked, damaged and destroyed during the Second World War rose again and were rebuilt for a new world.

programme.title: Queens That Changed The World
programme.sub-title: Boudicas husband Prasutagus, who was chief of the Iceni, died before Roman invaders beat her and had her daughters raped; in revenge, Boudica and her army razed Roman cities to the ground.
programme.desc: For so long believed to be side characters in histories dominated by men, some queens wielded extraordinary power; we discover how six women ruled in ways that far surpassed their male counterparts.

programme.title: Roman Megastructures
programme.sub-title: During the Gallic Wars, Arles in the south of France fared really well. The most beautiful Roman monuments were built there, hence Arles was nicknamed the little Rome of Ancient Gaul.
programme.desc: We explore three cities that were once part of Julius Caesars quest to grow the Roman Empire; through the use of CGI and expert testimony, we unveil the secrets of these wonders of Roman engineering.

programme.title: WWII: Frontlines
programme.sub-title: December 1944: with Europe in the grip of a terrible winter, Hitlers Panzers spearhead an attack on the Allied frontline in the Ardennes; they are to break through and re-capture the port of Antwerp.
programme.desc: From North Africa to Northern Europe and the Mediterranean to the Pacific, we reflect on the enormous diversity of conditions which frontline soldiers had to come to grips with during WWII.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: Researchers discovered a concrete city buried outside The Hague decades after WWII; more than 400 bunkers and defensive structures formed a vast underground network built to defend the coastline.
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: The World War: 1914-1945
programme.sub-title: In June 1914, the first steps towards war were made when Archduke Franz Ferdinand, from the house of Habsburg, was assassinated by Slav nationalist Gavrilo Princip.
programme.desc: A series that views the most violent and significant episodes in modern history from a fresh perspective - not as two world wars, but as a continuous narrative of error, ambition, and courage.

programme.title: World War II - Battles for Europe
programme.sub-title: September 1944: Montgomery proposes a bold plan to cross the Rhine and encircle Germanys industrial heartland. If successful, his plan could end the war by Christmas.
programme.desc: From the beaches of Normandy to the heartland of the Third Reich, this programme delivers compelling and definitive stories of the battles fought to liberate Western Europe from the Nazis.

programme.title: No Asylum: The Untold Chapter of Anne Franks Story
programme.desc: Newly-discovered letters of Anne Franks father Otto and interviews with their family reveal his struggle to save their family for the first time.

programme.title: Auschwitz - One Day
programme.desc: This documentary tells the story of a typical day in 1944 at the concentration camp of Auschwitz; it is based on a unique document which is kept in the Israeli memorial site of Yad Vashem.

programme.title: Roman Megastructures
programme.sub-title: Using 3D imagery, reconstitutions and interviews with historians and archaeologists, this episode tells the story of Gallo-Roman Paris and uncovers the vestiges of ancient Paris: Lutetia.
programme.desc: We explore three cities that were once part of Julius Caesars quest to grow the Roman Empire; through the use of CGI and expert testimony, we unveil the secrets of these wonders of Roman engineering.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: The Lost Japanese Treasure is thought to have been buried under the Philippines by retreating Japanese forces at the end of WWII; it is said to include relics, artwork, and gold melted down into bars.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Mummies Unwrapped
programme.sub-title: The shocking remains of a 3,000-year-old screaming mummy have haunted Egyptologists for decades; what happened to leave him looking like something from a horror film?
programme.desc: Come on a journey to some of the greatest mysteries of the ancient Egyptian world to discover the remarkable secrets behind unmarked sarcophagi, unusual burials, horribly disfigured mummies and more.

programme.title: The Giza Pyramid: Reaching For The Stars
programme.desc: The world is fascinated by the Pyramids of Giza; we explore theories and recent advances in archaeology, Egyptology and astrophysics to decipher the clues left behind by the ancient Egyptians.

programme.title: Viking Women: The Untold Story
programme.desc: What rank did Viking women occupy in a hierarchical world reputedly dominated by men? We reveal a complex society and offer a nuanced and precise portrait of the women of the frozen lands.

programme.title: WWII: Frontlines
programme.sub-title: February 1945: a quarter of all US Marines who died in WWII were killed in Iwo Jima; the Leathernecks were forced to re-think their tactics as one in three of them became a casualty.
programme.desc: From North Africa to Northern Europe and the Mediterranean to the Pacific, we reflect on the enormous diversity of conditions which frontline soldiers had to come to grips with during WWII.

programme.title: Secret Nazi Bases
programme.sub-title: The Nazis spent the war pillaging museums, emptying coffers, and stealing everything of value; with so much still missing, where did the Nazis hide their stolen hoards?
programme.desc: The collapse of the Third Reich left as many secrets as it did relics; remnants of the Nazis schemes still lie concealed in structures scattered across the globe today.

programme.title: The World War: 1914-1945
programme.sub-title: During WWI, men had to endure combat and extreme conditions; civilians dealt with food shortages and raids. The insidiousness of ethnic cleansing raised its head, and a young Adolf Hitler took note.
programme.desc: A series that views the most violent and significant episodes in modern history from a fresh perspective - not as two world wars, but as a continuous narrative of error, ambition, and courage.

programme.title: World War II - Battles for Europe
programme.sub-title: October 1944: the Allies face a major supply crisis - vital fuel and ammunition still has to be landed at the D-Day beaches. When the port of Antwerp is liberated, it seems the crisis might be over.
programme.desc: From the beaches of Normandy to the heartland of the Third Reich, this programme delivers compelling and definitive stories of the battles fought to liberate Western Europe from the Nazis.

programme.title: Why Planes Vanish: The Mystery of Flight MH370
programme.desc: Malaysia Airlines Flight MH370 disappeared with 239 passengers and crew on board on the 8th of March, 2014; this documentary looks at if new radio technology could help locate the missing aircraft.

programme.title: JFK: 24 Hours That Changed The World
programme.desc: To mark the 60th anniversary of the assassination of John F. Kennedy, this documentary brings together archival footage from across the world rarely seen by the general public.

programme.title: Caesars Doomsday War
programme.sub-title: Julius Caesar wanted to bring all of Gaul under his control, triggering a series of events that would bring his army to the brink of defeat - now archaeologists are uncovering what really happened.
programme.desc: Almost all evidence about the Gallic Wars came from an account written by the general himself; now historians and archaeologists are hunting for the truth about Caesars barbarian conquest.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: Part of the Nazi plan was to take control of most of Europes vast collection of artworks, treasures, and gold; the Nazis hid this massive loot down within mine shafts in Austria and Germany.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Forbidden History
programme.sub-title: Apparently imprinted with an image of Jesus crucified body, the Turin Shroud is one of Christianitys most famous holy relics; scientists battle to try to prove if its genuine or a fake.
programme.desc: This series tells incredible stories from the annals of history about great treasures, long-held conspiracy theories, ancient relics, lost civilisations and wartime secrets.

programme.title: Mummies Unwrapped
programme.sub-title: The disfigured mummy of the Younger Lady has mystified experts since she was first discovered over 100 years ago; investigators find out who she was using modern forensic science.
programme.desc: Come on a journey to some of the greatest mysteries of the ancient Egyptian world to discover the remarkable secrets behind unmarked sarcophagi, unusual burials, horribly disfigured mummies and more.

programme.title: Black Panthers of WW2
programme.desc: This documentary tells the story of the first African-American unit of WW2; known as the Black Panthers, they fought the Nazis on the front lines while battling discrimination from their own country.

programme.title: Sisi: Assassination of an Empress
programme.desc: September 10th, 1898: Italian anarchist Luigi Lucheni stabs the Austrian Empress Elisabeth with a file. The murder of the Empress is the beginning of a political struggle against anarchism in Europe.

programme.title: Caesars Doomsday War
programme.sub-title: Julius Caesar wanted to bring all of Gaul under his control, triggering a series of events that would bring his army to the brink of defeat - now archaeologists are uncovering what really happened.
programme.desc: Almost all evidence about the Gallic Wars came from an account written by the general himself; now historians and archaeologists are hunting for the truth about Caesars barbarian conquest.

programme.title: WWII: Frontlines
programme.sub-title: April 1945: Stalins generals compete to raise the Red Flag over the Reichstag; a Panzer Army, two army groups, and the home guard are locked in a desperate battle with the encircling Red Army.
programme.desc: From North Africa to Northern Europe and the Mediterranean to the Pacific, we reflect on the enormous diversity of conditions which frontline soldiers had to come to grips with during WWII.

programme.title: Tasakaal
programme.desc: Lahituleviku pimedas maailmas on igasugused emotsioonid keelatud. Seaduse vastu eksinud kohtuvad tundetute vaimulikega, kes havitavad kõike, mis seob inimkonda endise maailmaga. 2002

programme.title: Surematu 2
programme.desc: Jarg kõmufilmile MacLeodi klanni kuuluva surematu seiklustest. Kust on parit see salaparane klann ja kas seekord saadakse jagu diktaator Katanast? 1990

programme.title: Barbar
programme.desc: Airbnbs peatuv naine avastab, et tema renditud maja ei ole paris selline, nagu paistab.

programme.title: Suvetunnid
programme.desc: Kaks venda ja õde on tunnistajad oma lapsepõlvemalestuste kadumisele. Neil tuleb loobuda perekonna malestusesemetest, et sailitada kadunud ema parand.

programme.title: Segi

programme.title: Koletise ball
programme.desc: Peretragoodia sunnib rassistliku vangivalvuri oma vaartused umber hinnata, kui ta armub mustanahalisse naisesse, kes oli abielus tema poolt hiljuti hukatud vangiga.

programme.title: Vaike merineitsi
programme.desc: Kuri nõid kasutab ara nakineiu naiivsust ja roovib ta hinge. Paasta võiks neiu vaid tõeline armastus, mida ta kohtab noore muinasjutuvestja naol.

programme.title: Rulluisu-tudruk

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.sub-title: A leg infection hampers a young duikers release, Dr Amanda tracks and collars a young lion, and we check on an ailing bush baby and greet a new addition to the centre, a grumpy grey parrot.
programme.desc: The team at the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust in Malawi in Africa are dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating injured and orphaned animals, ensuring they get back into the wild where they belong.

programme.title: The Bizarre Pet Vets
programme.sub-title: Dr Hamish treats a bitey ferret called Nibbler, Dr James does a health check on Zeus the black-headed python, and Dr Michelle treats a talkative eclectus parrot with suspected reproductive problems.
programme.desc: Dr James Haberfield and his team from Unusual Pet Vets treat the most bizarre and beloved animals in Australia; with three clinics across the country, they see hundreds of species every week.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: A compilation of the best moments of this series; it includes capuchin monkeys, pink dolphins swimming in the Amazon, the munguba tree, orcas, flamingos, the majestic jaguar and much more...
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: A special episode focusing on births and babies; Julian heads to a local farm where a cow is struggling in labour, and baby goat Daisy has serious eye problems that are affecting her sight.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian rushes to a dramatic emergency at Jackie Barlows alpaca farm; with things returning to normal post-Covid, Peter returns to the Greens farm, where theres now lots of veterinary work to do.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Run into a lion-hyena showdown with Julz as he hunts for the elusive Manzi pack and join Henry from the Zambian Carnivore Program on a house call to the Kakumbi den where another pup has gone missing.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Join Julz and park scout Simon Chulu as they track the Kakuli pack and a Manzi faction thats ditched a tracking collar and broken away from the group.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: A future dispersal of young adult dogs in the Manzi pack looks inevitable, the dry season forces the Kakuli pack to take risks, and ecologist Henry identifies a new dog who has joined the Stork pack.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its Julzs last week; an encounter with lions scatters the Stork pack, Julz spots the Kakuli puppies feeding on a puku carcass, and the Manzi pack fight a warthog by the Luangwa River.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian is at Jackies alpaca farm to see one of his favourite alpacas, and Peters at Arthur Almonds farm because three of his cows need dehorning... but they arent used to being handled.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Its Sunday morning, but its no day of rest for Julian as he heads to the Taylors farm; at Skeldale, shih-tzu puppy Lester - who needs surgery on a hernia - has all the staff purring.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian meets two-year-old Zac and his hedgehog, who needs surgery on her foot, and Lorraine brings her dog Corbin - who has a lump thats causing him pain when he walks - to see Peter at Skeldale.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Europes Wilderness
programme.sub-title: Doru is almost a celebrity; this lynx was released from Romania to Croatia. The four-year-old animal is the first of many to be brought to the Dinaric Mountains as part of the Life Lynx project.
programme.desc: We present six of the largest, rarest and fastest animals in Europe; how does climate change affect them, and how do they defend their habitat against human influence?

programme.title: Europes Wilderness
programme.sub-title: The wolverine is the largest member of the weasel family; he lives hidden in Finlands woods, tears up moose, and is even said to take on adult brown bears and moose.
programme.desc: We present six of the largest, rarest and fastest animals in Europe; how does climate change affect them, and how do they defend their habitat against human influence?

programme.title: Backyard Bears of Transylvania
programme.desc: An ancient bear cult has survived deep in the Transylvanian forests - here Europes greatest land predator is a symbol of rebirth, but conflict is unavoidable with ever-increasing numbers.

programme.title: Germanys Wild North
programme.desc: Filmmaker Uwe Anders spent two years observing the wildlife of Germanys north, a region that defies all expectations with its incredible biodiversity and spectacular animal behaviour.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt arrives in eastern Zambia to film three packs of wild dogs - the Manzis, Kakulis and Stork Colony - in three very different territories.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its 100 degrees and rising; as waterholes dry up, Julz is alarmed to find lions in the Kakuli packs favourite drinking spot but also gets to touch a wild dog for the first time ever.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: In the heart of central America lurks a creature that instils fear in all who encounter it; Jeremy Wade is taken to breaking point and beyond as he relearns everything that he knows about fishing.
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Predator Countdown
programme.sub-title: We travel to Africa - where the law of the jungle reigns supreme - and follow the lives of lions, crocodiles, cheetahs while unravelling the steps of fate that brought predators and prey together.
programme.desc: We journey across Africa, Australia, North America and South America to witness the raw power and tenacity of natures most remarkable predators.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Theres a shock in the borderlands where the Stork Colony pack roams, Vultures, elephants, baboons, and hyenas make for noisy neighbours for the Manzi pack, and the Kakuli pack goes missing.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Julz discovers lions in Manzi territory and is relieved when he finds the dogs safe, a brave puku antelope foils a Kakuli pack hunt, and the Stork pack recovers after losing a pup.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Predator Countdown
programme.sub-title: We travel to Africa - where the law of the jungle reigns supreme - and follow the lives of lions, crocodiles, cheetahs while unravelling the steps of fate that brought predators and prey together.
programme.desc: We journey across Africa, Australia, North America and South America to witness the raw power and tenacity of natures most remarkable predators.

programme.title: Pride of India
programme.desc: Gujarat in India is home to the last Asiatic lions in the wild; a first-time mother lioness must be creative in her survival skills to raise a new king, and that includes fooling the old one.

programme.title: Patagonia: Earths Secret Paradise
programme.sub-title: This is the story of a coastline 4,000 miles long from Cape Horn - where rockhopper penguins raise their young - to the north where huge elephant seals battle for position in the heat of the desert.
programme.desc: This three-part series discovers the surprising stories of the unusual wildlife and the people that survive in epic Patagonian landscapes of volcanoes, glaciers, desert and treacherous oceans.

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.sub-title: Summer is the season of extremes, but things arent as simple as hot and cold; the top of the planet is in 24 hours of sunlight by June while the bottom is frozen in darkness.
programme.desc: We journey around the Sun in this series and witness the incredible strategies that animals use to cope with every season in their constantly changing worlds.

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.sub-title: Autumn is the season of change; change brings opportunity for many but also huge challenges. Time is running out and preparedness is key as the year draws to a close and winter returns.
programme.desc: We journey around the Sun in this series and witness the incredible strategies that animals use to cope with every season in their constantly changing worlds.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.sub-title: The team releases pythons, teaches a pangolin how to hunt, and rounds up a troop of vervet monkeys; they also search for a missing bird of prey and help a bush pig hurt by poachers dogs.
programme.desc: The team at the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust in Malawi in Africa are dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating injured and orphaned animals, ensuring they get back into the wild where they belong.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: A puppy fights against a deadly disease in the Karratha Vet Hospital, a chicken gets a prosthetic leg, and Dr Lu volunteers in a koala crisis caused by bushfires on Kangaroo Island.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: Patagonia, in the extreme south of the South American continent, is one of the most varied and diverse territories on Earth; we visit penguins, elephant seals, sea lions and orcas.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: Jeremy embarks on an epic mission to reveal the real creature behind the worlds most famous river monster - the Loch Ness Monster. Will he uncover the legend of legends?
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Predator Countdown
programme.sub-title: We venture into the arid landscapes of Australia to witness the extraordinary battles between predators and prey; among them are a large goanna reptile, saltwater crocodiles and many more.
programme.desc: We journey across Africa, Australia, North America and South America to witness the raw power and tenacity of natures most remarkable predators.

programme.title: Pride of India
programme.desc: Gujarat in India is home to the last Asiatic lions in the wild; a first-time mother lioness must be creative in her survival skills to raise a new king, and that includes fooling the old one.

programme.title: Patagonia: Earths Secret Paradise
programme.sub-title: This is the story of a coastline 4,000 miles long from Cape Horn - where rockhopper penguins raise their young - to the north where huge elephant seals battle for position in the heat of the desert.
programme.desc: This three-part series discovers the surprising stories of the unusual wildlife and the people that survive in epic Patagonian landscapes of volcanoes, glaciers, desert and treacherous oceans.

programme.title: A Year on Planet Earth
programme.sub-title: Summer is the season of extremes, but things arent as simple as hot and cold; the top of the planet is in 24 hours of sunlight by June while the bottom is frozen in darkness.
programme.desc: We journey around the Sun in this series and witness the incredible strategies that animals use to cope with every season in their constantly changing worlds.

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.sub-title: Jeremy embarks on an epic mission to reveal the real creature behind the worlds most famous river monster - the Loch Ness Monster. Will he uncover the legend of legends?
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade is on the hunt for freshwater fish with a taste for human flesh. Using forensic methods, Jeremy illustrates to the viewer how these river monsters are constructed to kill.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: A future dispersal of young adult dogs in the Manzi pack looks inevitable, the dry season forces the Kakuli pack to take risks, and ecologist Henry identifies a new dog who has joined the Stork pack.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its Julzs last week; an encounter with lions scatters the Stork pack, Julz spots the Kakuli puppies feeding on a puku carcass, and the Manzi pack fight a warthog by the Luangwa River.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Predator Countdown
programme.sub-title: We venture into the arid landscapes of Australia to witness the extraordinary battles between predators and prey; among them are a large goanna reptile, saltwater crocodiles and many more.
programme.desc: We journey across Africa, Australia, North America and South America to witness the raw power and tenacity of natures most remarkable predators.

programme.title: Brotherhood of Lions
programme.sub-title: Hunger drives the cubs to violence and family relationships are complicated; the lions rely on the more agile lionesses for hunting and face challenges such as climate change.
programme.desc: This series tells the compelling and immersive story of the daily life of young lions and their challenges while growing up; it also showcases the struggles and triumphs of the lions.

programme.title: Pride of India
programme.desc: Gujarat in India is home to the last Asiatic lions in the wild; a first-time mother lioness must be creative in her survival skills to raise a new king, and that includes fooling the old one.

programme.title: In Search of Snow Leopards: Chasing Shadows
programme.desc: We reveal the fascinating life of the snow leopards - the most secretive and least understood of all the great cats - as they are filmed in Spiti Valley in the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh.

programme.title: In Search of Snow Leopards: Chasing Shadows
programme.desc: We reveal the fascinating life of the snow leopards - the most secretive and least understood of all the great cats - as they are filmed in Spiti Valley in the Indian state of Himachal Pradesh.

programme.title: Malawi Wildlife Rescue
programme.sub-title: Dr Amanda removes a sable antelopes collar, and the team helps a baby vervet monkey find a new mum; two orphaned serval cats are also freed, and we follow 20 yellow baboons into their new enclosure.
programme.desc: The team at the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust in Malawi in Africa are dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating injured and orphaned animals, ensuring they get back into the wild where they belong.

programme.title: Outback Vet
programme.sub-title: Cyclone Damien, the biggest cyclone to hit Karratha for ten years, heads towards the Vet Hospital; meanwhile, a lady prepares to cross Australia by camel in the Pilbara desert.
programme.desc: Meet Rick Fenny, a 40-year career veterinarian; he regularly embarks on a round trip across Western Australia to visit remote clients, working with animals in some of the most hostile conditions.

programme.title: Wild LatAm
programme.sub-title: The desert of Chile is the driest in the world, but its marine currents are thought to be the richest on the planet; we come across Andean flamingos, burrowing owls, and the Fabians lizard.
programme.desc: A vibrant portrait of the biodiverse habitats in South America; inhabitants range from large to small, from colourful to perfectly camouflaged, and from the lone hunter to thousand-strong hordes.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: Julian races to an emergency at a local farm where a cow is unable to stand up, and Peter tries to save three-week-old Sphynx kitten Dobby; his tiny patient has pneumonia.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: The Yorkshire Vet
programme.sub-title: This episode marks International Dog Day; Julian has performed lots of surgery on his clients four-legged friends, but its a bit different when the patient is his own faithful companion Emmy.
programme.desc: Skeldales team have a real passion for animals; with a clientele that rarely has insurance, animal welfare always comes before profit together with an extra dose of tender loving care.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Join Julz on a ZCP lion-collaring mission, go fishing with scout Simon, study mealtime pack hierarchy and witness a heartbreaking vigil for a badly-injured Kakumbi pup.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Pack vs Pride
programme.sub-title: Head back to the den with the Kakumbi - who are mourning the loss of two pups - and chance upon a hyena lair and a lion pride trying to take down a buffalo.
programme.desc: Cameraman Julz Braatvedt returns to the South Luangwa National Park to see the Kakumbi, Manzi and Kakuli packs back in action alongside lions, warthogs, buffalo, leopards, elephants and hyenas.

programme.desc: The team at the Lilongwe Wildlife Trust in Malawi in Africa are dedicated to rescuing and rehabilitating injured and orphaned animals, ensuring they get back into the wild where they belong.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Its 100 degrees and rising; as waterholes dry up, Julz is alarmed to find lions in the Kakuli packs favourite drinking spot but also gets to touch a wild dog for the first time ever.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.

programme.title: Wild Dogs: Running with the Pack
programme.sub-title: Theres a shock in the borderlands where the Stork Colony pack roams, Vultures, elephants, baboons, and hyenas make for noisy neighbours for the Manzi pack, and the Kakuli pack goes missing.
programme.desc: Wildlife cameraman Julz Braatvedt visits the South Luangwa National Park in eastern Zambia to follow three wild dog packs for six weeks during the dry season.
